name: Walther PPK
description: A compact semi-automatic pistol famously used by James Bond as his signature sidearm.

content.title: Overview
content.body: **Walther PPK** is a compact semi-automatic pistol notable for its concealability and reliability. Created primarily for self-defense and covert operations, it has become an iconic weapon in espionage fiction, particularly as the favored firearm of the British secret agent James Bond.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: The Walther PPK features a sleek, all-metal frame with a short barrel and slide, typically finished in blued steel. It is recognizable by its smooth contours, wooden or synthetic grips, and compact size optimized for concealment. The pistol is small enough to be comfortably carried concealed yet large enough to maintain effective stopping power.

content.title: Function
content.body: The PPK is a double-action/single-action semi-automatic pistol chambered usually in .32 ACP or .380 ACP calibers. It has a fixed barrel and a blowback-operated mechanism, known for its ease of use, reasonable accuracy, and moderate recoil. It holds a magazine capacity of 7 or 8 rounds depending on the caliber. The pistol is designed for quick draw and accurate close-to-medium range shooting.

content.title: History
content.body: Designed in the 1930s by Carl Walther GmbH, the Walther PPK was initially introduced as a compact variant of the Walther PP. It became widely recognized greatly through James Bond novels by Ian Fleming and subsequent films. Bond’s use of the PPK helped cement its place in popular culture as a quintessential spy weapon, symbolizing British sophistication and deadly efficiency.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body:
The Walther PPK is James Bond's trademark sidearm throughout many of his missions. It is featured in numerous iconic scenes, such as:

- Bond using it to evade capture or silence enemies with precision.
- The pistol's concealability frequently saving Bond in tight situations.
- Its distinctive click and appearance becoming synonymous with the character’s lethal skill and suave demeanor.

The PPK is not only a tool but a symbol of Bond’s identity as a suave and dangerous spy.
